page.title: 09Landscape and vegetation
page.content: The site overall is very beautiful.The field leading to the top of St. Catherine's Hill is very uneven.The land seems very well cared for. One of the fields is used for the grazing of cows.The field is not large.It is enclosed by a wooden fence topped with barbed wire. At the top of the hill,there are evenly spaced trees.Between each tree there appeared to be 3 or 4 metres ofland that could be cultivated.The paths seem to be lined with beautiful pine trees.The scenery is part of Avon Forest Park which belongs to Dorset County Council.
